docs.snippet: Facebook faces substantial business risks from new European Union privacy rules set to take effect in May, a looming reality that came into stark relief over the weekend with revelations that a controversial political consulting firm had improperl...

headline.print_headline: Privacy Issues Emerge as Major Business Risk for Facebook
headline.main: Privacy Issues Emerge as Major Business Risk for Facebook

docs.snippet: Stock indexes finished mostly higher after a day of bouncing around Tuesday as retailers, energy companies and banks recovered some of their losses from the day before, but technology companies struggled as Facebook dropped again.

headline.print_headline: Stock Indexes End Mostly Higher, but Facebook Sinks Again
headline.main: Stock Indexes End Mostly Higher, but Facebook Sinks Again

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: Kim Jong-un, Facebook, Sacramento: Your Wednesday Briefing

docs.snippet: EU lawmakers will investigate whether the data of more than 50 million Facebook users has been misused, the head of European Parliament said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: EU Lawmakers to Investigate Alleged Misuse of Facebook Users' Data
headline.main: EU Lawmakers to Investigate Alleged Misuse of Facebook Users' Data

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Report Says Facebook Security Chief to Leave
headline.main: The Latest: Report Says Facebook Security Chief to Leave

docs.snippet: The psychologist at the centre of a scandal over the misuse of millions of Facebook users' personal data worked with Russian researchers on a study of toxic personality traits.

headline.print_headline: Academic in Facebook Storm Worked on Russian 'Dark' Personality Project
headline.main: Academic in Facebook Storm Worked on Russian 'Dark' Personality Project

docs.snippet: State attorneys general for Massachusetts and New York sent a letter to Facebook Inc on Tuesday demanding information about personal data that ended up in the hands of analytics firm Cambridge Analytica, a person familiar with the matter said.

headline.print_headline: Massachusetts, New York Send Letter to Facebook Demanding Documents
headline.main: Massachusetts, New York Send Letter to Facebook Demanding Documents

docs.snippet: Germany's second-largest bank, Commerzbank, has suspended advertising on Facebook until further notice, after a massive leak of user data, its head of brand strategy told the Handelsblatt business daily.

headline.print_headline: Commerzbank Suspends Ads on Facebook After Data Leak
headline.main: Commerzbank Suspends Ads on Facebook After Data Leak

docs.snippet: Noah said Facebook needed “to be held accountable” for a data leak that compromised millions of users’ personal information.

headline.print_headline: Trevor Noah Attacks Facebook and Urges Users to ‘Be Vigilant’
headline.main: Trevor Noah Attacks Facebook and Urges Users to ‘Be Vigilant’

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc faced new calls for regulation from within U.S. Congress and was hit with questions about personal data safeguards on Saturday after reports a political consultant gained inappropriate access to 50 million users' data starting in 2014...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Critics Want Regulation, Investigation After Data Misuse
headline.main: Facebook Critics Want Regulation, Investigation After Data Misuse
